clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy of Tranexamic Acid in Reducing Myomectomy Associated Blood Loss in Federal Teaching Hospital Abakaliki.
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of Tranexamic Acid in Reducing Myomectomy Associated Blood Loss in Federal Teaching Hospital Abakaliki

lead_sponsor.agency: Alex Ekwueme Federal University Teaching Hospital

clinical_study.source: Alex Ekwueme Federal University Teaching Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: to determine safety and efficacy of Tranexamic Acid in reducing blood loss during Myomectomy in our institution.

detailed_description.textblock: A double blinded randomized controlled trial in which cases were given 1000mg intravenous tranexamic acid into 1L of intravenous normal saline and control were given 10mls of placebo water for injection into same amount of intravenous fluid. outcome of both groups in terms of intraoperative blood loss, duration of surgery, postoperative packed cell volume and total blood loss with risk of blood transfusion were then determined.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: two groups comprising of cases and control

primary_outcome.measure: Average duration of surgery in each group
primary_outcome.description: Average duration of Surgeries were calculated for each group
The mean intraoperative blood loss was calculated for both groups
Average Postoperative Haemoglobin concentration of both groups were determined

secondary_outcome.description: Risk of Blood Transfusion of both groups were determined

clinical_study.condition: To Determine Efficacy of Tranexamic Acid in Reducing Blood Loss During Myomectomy

arm_group.arm_group_label: group A: Cases that had tranexamic acid infusion
arm_group.description: Group A had perioperative tranexamic acid infusion at the rate of 100mls per hour
control were given perioperative placebo at the rate of 100mls per hour

intervention.description: intravenous perioperative tranexamic acid was added into infusion of normal saline for the cases while placebo of intravenous water for injection was added into normal saline perioperatively for control
intervention.arm_group_label: group A: Cases that had tranexamic acid infusion

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- non-pregnant women with symptomatic myomas women with no known contraindication to tranexamic acid
Exclusion Criteria:
- past history of thromboembolic disorder, ischaemic heart disease, malignancy or liver disease
